description: This Kotlin source file defines the MainActivity class for an Android app that implements voice-controlled commands for launching apps, making calls, sending messages, navigation, and media control. It manages speech recognition, UI interactions, permissions, and command parsing.

classes.name: MainActivity
classes.description: Primary activity managing voice commands, UI, and integrations in the app.

methods.name: onCreate
methods.description: Initializes the activity, UI components, voice recognition, and permissions.

methods.name: onDestroy
methods.description: Cleans up speech recognizer resources upon activity destruction.

methods.name: wireTileHandlers
methods.description: Sets click listeners for UI buttons to trigger specific actions.

methods.name: setupVoice
methods.description: Configures speech recognizer and recognition intent.

methods.name: requestNeededPermissions
methods.description: Requests runtime permissions necessary for voice and call functionalities.

methods.name: onRequestPermissionsResult
methods.description: Handles responses to permission requests, providing user feedback.

methods.name: handleRecognizedText
methods.description: Processes recognized speech and executes corresponding commands.

methods.name: openSpotifyOrShowMessage
methods.description: Launches Spotify app or shows a message if not installed.

methods.name: launchMapsWithDestination
methods.description: Opens Google Maps with specified destination.

methods.name: placeCall
methods.description: Initiates a phone call to the specified number.

methods.name: openDialer
methods.description: Opens the dialer app with optional pre-filled number.

methods.name: openDefaultSmsComposer
methods.description: Opens SMS composer with optional recipient and body.

methods.name: openWhatsAppOrShowMessage
methods.description: Opens WhatsApp or shows message if not installed.

methods.name: setStatus
methods.description: Updates the status TextView on the UI thread.

methods.name: toast
methods.description: Shows a Toast message on the UI thread.
